Geochemical proxies (Fig. 6) of weathering intensity including Ba/Sr
58, 65 , CIA
65 , and its modified version ∆W
65 show consistent negative excursions at the fossil assemblage zone and the PTB interval. Sensitive proxies of salinity change including Rb/K
66 and (K + Na)/Al
65 are relatively low (Fig. 6), whereas Rb/K values apparently increase at the fossil spots and the PTB interval. Values of (K + Na)/Al and Al/Si
66 (Supplementary Table S5) indicate a relatively low palaeotemperature at the fossil spots and the PTB interval. Mg/Ca, Sr/Ca and Ba/Ca
67, 68 (Fig. 6) consistently show negative excursions at the fossil assemblage zone and the PTB interval while Sc/Zr and Lu/Hf
67 show strong negative excursions at these points.
